## FURTHER MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 328, 154, 343]]<|/det|>
Paper 1  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[784, 305, 907, 320]]<|/det|>
9231/13

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 370, 418, 386]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 392, 468, 408]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: List of Formulae (MF10)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 418, 390, 435]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 448, 787, 464]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name in the spaces at the top of this page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 464, 327, 479]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 479, 504, 495]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 495, 504, 510]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 510, 380, 525]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 540, 285, 555]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 555, 910, 586]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 585, 507, 600]]<|/det|>
The use of a calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 600, 910, 630]]<|/det|>
Results obtained solely from a graphic calculator, without supporting working or reasoning, will not receive credit.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 630, 608, 645]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 658, 606, 673]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 673, 757, 689]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 81, 97, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 75, 821, 104]]<|/det|>
A curve \(C\) has equation \(x^{3} - 3xy + y^{2} = 4\). Find the value of \(\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}y}{\mathrm{dx}^{2}}\) at the point (0, 2) of \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 79, 920, 100]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 73, 406, 92]]<|/det|>
A curve \(C\) has parametric equations

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[336, 100, 658, 123]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{2}{5} t^{\frac{5}{2}} - 2t^{\frac{1}{2}}, \quad y = \frac{4}{3} t^{\frac{3}{2}}, \quad \text{for } 1 \leqslant t \leqslant 4.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 144, 156, 163]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 144, 500, 163]]<|/det|>
Find the exact value of the arc length of \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 144, 920, 163]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
Find also the exact value of the surface area generated when \(C\) is rotated through \(2\pi\) radians about the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 78, 153, 96]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 920, 121]]<|/det|>
Use the result for integrating \(\frac{1}{x^2 + a^2}\) with respect to \(x\), in the List of Formulae (MF10), to find the value of \(I_1\) and deduce that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[428, 125, 567, 151]]<|/det|>
\[I_{3} = \frac{3}{1024}\pi +\frac{1}{128}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 128, 920, 147]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 73, 156, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[161, 73, 463, 92]]<|/det|>
Use de Moivre's theorem to prove that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[379, 102, 620, 135]]<|/det|>
\[\tan 4\theta = \frac{4\tan\theta - 4\tan^3\theta}{1 - 6\tan^2\theta + \tan^4\theta}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 109, 920, 128]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 477, 92]]<|/det|>
Hence find the solutions of the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 98, 603, 119]]<|/det|>
\[t^{4} - 4t^{3} - 6t^{2} + 4t + 1 = 0,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 127, 707, 146]]<|/det|>
giving your answers in the form \(\tan k\pi\), where \(k\) is a rational number.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 127, 920, 145]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 472, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the solution of the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[371, 100, 628, 134]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}x}{\mathrm{d}t^{2}} +6\frac{\mathrm{d}x}{\mathrm{d}t} +9x = 18t^{2} + 6t + 1,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 144, 448, 170]]<|/det|>
given that, when \(t = 0\), \(x = 3\) and \(\frac{\mathrm{d}x}{\mathrm{d}t} = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[880, 147, 920, 165]]<|/det|>
<mark>[10]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 104, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 321, 92]]<|/det|>
The matrix \(\mathbf{A}\) is given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[420, 92, 581, 144]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{A} = \left( \begin{array}{ccc}6 & -8 & 7\\ 7 & -9 & 7\\ 6 & -6 & 5 \end{array} \right).\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 163, 156, 186]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 160, 198, 186]]<|/det|>
Given that

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[198, 160, 747, 207]]<|/det|>
is an eigenvector of \(\mathbf{A}\), find the corresponding eigenvalue.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 175, 920, 193]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 432, 191, 451]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[188, 432, 755, 451]]<|/det|>
Given also that \(-1\) is an eigenvalue of \(\mathbf{A}\), find a corresponding eigenvector.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 432, 920, 451]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 153, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
It is given that the determinant of \(\mathbf{A}\) is equal to the product of the eigenvalues of \(\mathbf{A}\). Use this result to find the third eigenvalue of \(\mathbf{A}\), and find also a corresponding eigenvector. [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(iv)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
Write down matrices \(\mathbf{P}\) and \(\mathbf{D}\) such that \(\mathbf{P}^{-1}\mathbf{A}\mathbf{P} = \mathbf{D}\), where \(\mathbf{D}\) is a diagonal matrix, and hence find the matrix \(\mathbf{A}^n\) in terms of \(n\), where \(n\) is a positive integer.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 104, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 524, 92]]<|/det|>
Answer only **one** of the following two alternatives.

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 104, 201, 123]]<|/det|>
# EITHER

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 135, 881, 154]]<|/det|>
A curve \(C\) has polar equation \(r = 2a\cos \left(2\theta +\frac{1}{2}\pi\right)\) for \(0\leqslant \theta < 2\pi\), where \(a\) is a positive constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 168, 156, 186]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 168, 472, 186]]<|/det|>
Show that \(r = -2a \sin 2\theta\) and sketch \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 168, 920, 186]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 608, 186, 625]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 608, 494, 625]]<|/det|>
Deduce that the cartesian equation of \(C\) is

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[418, 635, 579, 657]]<|/det|>
\[(x^{2} + y^{2})^{\frac{3}{2}} = -4axy.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 638, 920, 657]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 685, 920, 704]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<form>......

<form>......

<form>......

<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 870, 920, 888]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 944, 165, 959]]<|/det|>
<label>Â©</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[165, 944, 165, 959]]<|/det|>
<label>UCLES</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[165, 944, 165, 959]]<|/det|>
2017

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[453, 944, 544, 959]]<|/det|>
<form>9231/13/M/J/17</form>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[821, 944, 920, 959]]<|/det|>
<mark>[Turn over

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 405, 91]]<|/det|>
Find the area of one loop of \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 153, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(iv)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
Show that, at the points (other than the pole) at which a tangent to \(C\) is parallel to the initial line,

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[425, 98, 571, 117]]<|/det|>
\[2\tan \theta = -\tan 2\theta .\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 98, 920, 117]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 151, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>OR</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 104, 307, 123]]<|/det|>
The matrix \(\mathbf{A}\), given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[384, 123, 616, 196]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{A} = \left( \begin{array}{cccc}1 & -1 & 0 & 2\\ 3 & -1 & 4 & 0\\ 5 & -8 & -6 & 19\\ -2 & 3 & 2 & -7 \end{array} \right),\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 198, 458, 217]]<|/det|>
represents a transformation from \(\mathbb{R}^4\) to \(\mathbb{R}^4\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 228, 156, 250]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 230, 920, 312]]<|/det|>
Find the rank of \(\mathbf{A}\) and show that \(\left\{ \begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ -1 \\ 0 \end{pmatrix}, \begin{pmatrix} 1 \\ 3 \\ 0 \end{pmatrix} \right\}\) is a basis for the null space of the transformation.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 294, 920, 312]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 504, 186, 521]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[180, 504, 260, 521]]<|/det|>
Show that if

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 521, 606, 592]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{A}\mathbf{x} = p\left( \begin{array}{c}1\\ 3\\ 5\\ -2 \end{array} \right) + q\left( \begin{array}{c} - 1\\ - 1\\ - 8\\ 3 \end{array} \right),\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 593, 504, 612]]<|/det|>
where \(p\) and \(q\) are given real numbers, then

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[415, 617, 583, 689]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{x} = \left( \begin{array}{c}p + 2\lambda +\mu \\ q + 2\lambda +3\mu \\ -\lambda \\ \mu \end{array} \right),\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 695, 416, 714]]<|/det|>
where \(\lambda\) and \(\mu\) are real numbers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 696, 920, 714]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 74, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 445, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(p\) and \(q\) such that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[376, 95, 625, 166]]<|/det|>
\[p\left( \begin{array}{c}1\\ 3\\ 5\\ -2 \end{array} \right) + q\left( \begin{array}{c} - 1\\ - 1\\ - 8\\ 3 \end{array} \right) = \left( \begin{array}{c}3\\ 7\\ 18\\ - 7 \end{array} \right). \quad [3]\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 121, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 425, 191, 443]]<|/det|>
<label>(iv)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 435, 922, 490]]<|/det|>
Find the solution of the equation \(\mathbf{Ax} = \left( \begin{array}{c}3\\ 7\\ 18\\ - 7 \end{array} \right)\) of the form \(\mathbf{x} = \left( \begin{array}{c}4\\ 9\\ \alpha \\ \beta \end{array} \right)\), where \(\alpha\) and \(\beta\) are positive integers to be found.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 482, 920, 500]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]
